alert.note: Alert for Boise (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 8:37PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Idaho, including the following county, Boise. * WHEN...Until midnight MDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Heavy rain may trigger rock and mud slides are possible along steep slopes of Banks to Lowman road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 837 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to occur in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding and possible rock and mud slides along the Banks to Lowman road. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Crouch, Banks to Lowman road. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
